item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 12, 2024 at 9:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. A ChatGPT clone, in 3000 bytes of C, backed by GPT-2 (2023) (169 points | 39 comments)
2. FCC opens entire 6 GHz band to low power device operations (573 points | 201 comments)
3. Run Database in GitHub Actions, Persisting Data to S3, and Access It Publicly (15 points | 10 comments)
4. Mysterious New Jersey drone sightings prompt call for 'state of emergency' (304 points | 475 comments)
5. Gemini 2.0: our new AI model for the agentic era (759 points | 382 comments)
6. Certain names make ChatGPT grind to a halt, and we know why (77 points | 27 comments)
7. Ham Radio All-in-One-Cable (119 points | 20 comments)
8. The Cold Email Handbook (212 points | 92 comments)
9. QEMU with VirtIO GPU Vulkan Support (186 points | 37 comments)
10. Review of Mullvad VPN (335 points | 109 comments)
11. PeerTube mobile app: discover videos while caring for your attention (375 points | 130 comments)
12. OnlyFans models are using AI impersonators to keep up with their DMs (236 points | 295 comments)
13. Tricking c64 basic into clearing a hi-res screen quickly (36 points | 6 comments)
14. Small Businesses vs. Corporations: What Tech Tools Are We Missing? (7 points | 5 comments)
15. Deciphering C++ compiler errors: Nonsensical errors from a function declaration (24 points | 10 comments)
16. Geometry clipmaps: simple terrain rendering with level of detail (2017) (12 points | discuss)
17. Pgroll – Zero-downtime, reversible, schema changes for PostgreSQL (new website) (212 points | 41 comments)
18. Stimulating parts of the brain can help the paralysed to walk again (5 points | 1 comment)
19. Launch HN: Azalea Robotics (YC S24) – Baggage-handling robots for airports (103 points | 61 comments)
20. Instant macOS install on Proxmox including AMD patches (129 points | 40 comments)
21. The GPU is not always faster (149 points | 75 comments)
22. Evolving my ergonomic setup (or, my laptop with extra steps) (138 points | 72 comments)
23. 2400 phone providers may be shut down by the FCC for failing to stop robocalls (325 points | 208 comments)
24. RISC-V HiFive Premier P550 Development Boards with Ubuntu Now Available (144 points | 73 comments)
25. Dear OAuth Providers (232 points | 57 comments)
26. The Myth of Bananaland (127 points | 95 comments)
27. Dioxus 0.6 – Crossplatform apps with Rust (224 points | 90 comments)
28. A letter to open-source maintainers (133 points | 50 comments)
29. Storing Times for Human Events (113 points | 48 comments)
30. Django and Postgres for the Busy Rails Developer (163 points | 90 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 12, 2024 at 9:20 AM UTC
